question: Reliability of files can be increased by _____________
options: ['a) keeping the files safely in the memory', 'b) making a different partition for the files', 'c) by keeping them in external storage', 'd) by keeping duplicate copies of the file']
option1: a) keeping the files safely in the memory
option2: b) making a different partition for the files
option3: c) by keeping them in external storage
option4: d) by keeping duplicate copies of the file

question: Protection is only provided at the _____ level
options: ['a) lower', 'b) central', 'c) higher', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: What is the main problem with access control lists?
options: ['a) their maintenance', 'b) their length', 'c) their permissions', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: Many systems recognize three classifications of users in connection with each file (to condense the access control list)
options: ['a) Owner', 'b) Group', 'c) Universe', 'd) All of the mentioned']

question: All users in a group get _______ access to a file
options: ['a) different', 'b) similar', 'c) same', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: Universe consists of _____________
options: ['a) all users that aren’t included in the group or owners', 'b) all users that are not owners', 'c) all users in the system', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) all users that aren’t included in the group or owners
option2: b) all users that are not owners
option3: c) all users in the system

question: In UNIX, groups can be created and modified by?
options: ['a) superuser', 'b) any user', 'c) a programmer only', 'd) the people in the group only']
option4: d) the people in the group only

question: To control access the three bits used in UNIX are represented by _____________
options: ['a) r', 'b) w', 'c) x', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: If each access to a file is controlled by a password, then what is the disadvantage?
options: ['a) user will need to remember a lot of passwords', 'b) it is not reliable', 'c) it is not efficient', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) user will need to remember a lot of passwords

question: What will happen in a multi level directory structure?
options: ['a) the same previous techniques will be used as in the other structures', 'b) a mechanism for directory protection will have to applied', 'c) the subdirectories do not need protection once the directory is protected', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the same previous techniques will be used as in the other structures
option2: b) a mechanism for directory protection will have to applied
option3: c) the subdirectories do not need protection once the directory is protected

question: In UNIX, the directory protection is handled _________ to the file protection
options: ['a) different', 'b) similar', 'c) it is not handled at all', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) it is not handled at all

question: Disks are segmented into one or more partitions, each containing a file system or ______
options: ['a) left ‘raw’', 'b) made into swap space', 'c) made into backup space', 'd) left ‘ripe’']
